00039 #define CL_MEM_PTR(p) ((cl_mem)(unsigned long)(p))

00041 class OpenCLDevice : public Device
00042 {
00043 public:

00045     cl_command_queue cqCommandQueue;
00046     cl_platform_id cpPlatform;
00047     cl_device_id cdDevice;

00058     const char *opencl_error_string(cl_int err)
00059     {
00060         switch (err) {
00061             case CL_SUCCESS: return "Success!";
00062             case CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND: return "Device not found.";
00063             case CL_DEVICE_NOT_AVAILABLE: return "Device not available";
00064             case CL_COMPILER_NOT_AVAILABLE: return "Compiler not available";
00065             case CL_MEM_OBJECT_ALLOCATION_FAILURE: return "Memory object allocation failure";
00066             case CL_OUT_OF_RESOURCES: return "Out of resources";
00067             case CL_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY: return "Out of host memory";
00068             case CL_PROFILING_INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE: return "Profiling information not available";
00069             case CL_MEM_COPY_OVERLAP: return "Memory copy overlap";
00070             case CL_IMAGE_FORMAT_MISMATCH: return "Image format mismatch";
00071             case CL_IMAGE_FORMAT_NOT_SUPPORTED: return "Image format not supported";
00072             case CL_BUILD_PROGRAM_FAILURE: return "Program build failure";
00073             case CL_MAP_FAILURE: return "Map failure";
00074             case CL_INVALID_VALUE: return "Invalid value";
00075             case CL_INVALID_DEVICE_TYPE: return "Invalid device type";
00076             case CL_INVALID_PLATFORM: return "Invalid platform";
00077             case CL_INVALID_DEVICE: return "Invalid device";
00078             case CL_INVALID_CONTEXT: return "Invalid context";
00079             case CL_INVALID_QUEUE_PROPERTIES: return "Invalid queue properties";
00080             case CL_INVALID_COMMAND_QUEUE: return "Invalid command queue";
00081             case CL_INVALID_HOST_PTR: return "Invalid host pointer";
00082             case CL_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT: return "Invalid memory object";
00083             case CL_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT_DESCRIPTOR: return "Invalid image format descriptor";
00084             case CL_INVALID_IMAGE_SIZE: return "Invalid image size";
00085             case CL_INVALID_SAMPLER: return "Invalid sampler";
00086             case CL_INVALID_BINARY: return "Invalid binary";
00087             case CL_INVALID_BUILD_OPTIONS: return "Invalid build options";
00088             case CL_INVALID_PROGRAM: return "Invalid program";
00089             case CL_INVALID_PROGRAM_EXECUTABLE: return "Invalid program executable";
00090             case CL_INVALID_KERNEL_NAME: return "Invalid kernel name";
00091             case CL_INVALID_KERNEL_DEFINITION: return "Invalid kernel definition";
00092             case CL_INVALID_KERNEL: return "Invalid kernel";
00093             case CL_INVALID_ARG_INDEX: return "Invalid argument index";
00094             case CL_INVALID_ARG_VALUE: return "Invalid argument value";
00095             case CL_INVALID_ARG_SIZE: return "Invalid argument size";
00096             case CL_INVALID_KERNEL_ARGS: return "Invalid kernel arguments";
00097             case CL_INVALID_WORK_DIMENSION: return "Invalid work dimension";
00098             case CL_INVALID_WORK_GROUP_SIZE: return "Invalid work group size";
00099             case CL_INVALID_WORK_ITEM_SIZE: return "Invalid work item size";
00100             case CL_INVALID_GLOBAL_OFFSET: return "Invalid global offset";
00101             case CL_INVALID_EVENT_WAIT_LIST: return "Invalid event wait list";
00102             case CL_INVALID_EVENT: return "Invalid event";
00103             case CL_INVALID_OPERATION: return "Invalid operation";
00104             case CL_INVALID_GL_OBJECT: return "Invalid OpenGL object";
00105             case CL_INVALID_BUFFER_SIZE: return "Invalid buffer size";
00106             case CL_INVALID_MIP_LEVEL: return "Invalid mip-map level";
00107             default: return "Unknown";
00108         }
00109     }

00111     bool opencl_error(cl_int err)
00112     {
00113         if(err != CL_SUCCESS) {
00114             string message = string_printf("OpenCL error (%d): %s", err, opencl_error_string(err));
00115             if(error_msg == "")
00116                 error_msg = message;
00117             fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", message.c_str());
00118             return true;
00119         }
00120 
00121         return false;
00122     }
00123 
00124     void opencl_error(const string& message)
00125     {
00126         if(error_msg == "")
00127             error_msg = message;
00128         fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", message.c_str());
00129     }
00130 
00131     void opencl_assert(cl_int err)
00132     {
00133         if(err != CL_SUCCESS) {
00134             string message = string_printf("OpenCL error (%d): %s", err, opencl_error_string(err));
00135             if(error_msg == "")
00136                 error_msg = message;
00137             fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", message.c_str());
00138 #ifndef NDEBUG
00139             abort();
00140 #endif
00141         }
00142     }
00143 
00144     OpenCLDevice(DeviceInfo& info, bool background_)
00145     {
00146         background = background_;
00147         cpPlatform = NULL;
00148         cxContext = NULL;
00149         cqCommandQueue = NULL;
00150         cpProgram = NULL;
00151         ckPathTraceKernel = NULL;
00152         ckFilmConvertKernel = NULL;
00153         null_mem = 0;
00154         device_initialized = false;
00155 
00156         /* setup platform */
00157         cl_uint num_platforms;
00158 
00159         ciErr = clGetPlatformIDs(0, NULL, &num_platforms);
00160         if(opencl_error(ciErr))
00161             return;
00162 
00163         if(num_platforms == 0) {
00164             opencl_error("OpenCL: no platforms found.");
00165             return;
00166         }
00167 
00168         ciErr = clGetPlatformIDs(1, &cpPlatform, NULL);
00169         if(opencl_error(ciErr))
00170             return;
00171 
00172         char name[256];
00173         clGetPlatformInfo(cpPlatform, CL_PLATFORM_NAME, sizeof(name), &name, NULL);
00174         platform_name = name;
00175 
00176         /* get devices */
00177         vector<cl_device_id> device_ids;
00178         cl_uint num_devices;
00179 
00180         if(opencl_error(clGetDeviceIDs(cpPlatform, CL_DEVICE_TYPE_GPU|CL_DEVICE_TYPE_ACCELERATOR, 0, NULL, &num_devices)))
00181             return;
00182 
00183         if(info.num > num_devices) {
00184             if(num_devices == 0)
00185                 opencl_error("OpenCL: no devices found.");
00186             else
00187                 opencl_error("OpenCL: specified device not found.");
00188             return;
00189         }
00190 
00191         device_ids.resize(num_devices);
00192         
00193         if(opencl_error(clGetDeviceIDs(cpPlatform, CL_DEVICE_TYPE_GPU|CL_DEVICE_TYPE_ACCELERATOR, num_devices, &device_ids[0], NULL)))
00194             return;
00195 
00196         cdDevice = device_ids[info.num];
00197 
00198         /* create context */
00199         cxContext = clCreateContext(0, 1, &cdDevice, NULL, NULL, &ciErr);
00200         if(opencl_error(ciErr))
00201             return;
00202 
00203         cqCommandQueue = clCreateCommandQueue(cxContext, cdDevice, 0, &ciErr);
00204         if(opencl_error(ciErr))
00205             return;
00206 
00207         null_mem = (device_ptr)clCreateBuffer(cxContext, CL_MEM_READ_ONLY, 1, NULL, &ciErr);
00208         device_initialized = true;
00209     }
00210 
00211     bool opencl_version_check()
00212     {
00213         char version[256];
00214 
00215         int major, minor, req_major = 1, req_minor = 1;
00216 
00217         clGetPlatformInfo(cpPlatform, CL_PLATFORM_VERSION, sizeof(version), &version, NULL);
00218 
00219         if(sscanf(version, "OpenCL %d.%d", &major, &minor) < 2) {
00220             opencl_error(string_printf("OpenCL: failed to parse platform version string (%s).", version));
00221             return false;
00222         }
00223 
00224         if(!((major == req_major && minor >= req_minor) || (major > req_major))) {
00225             opencl_error(string_printf("OpenCL: platform version 1.1 or later required, found %d.%d", major, minor));
00226             return false;
00227         }
00228 
00229         clGetDeviceInfo(cdDevice, CL_DEVICE_OPENCL_C_VERSION, sizeof(version), &version, NULL);
00230 
00231         if(sscanf(version, "OpenCL C %d.%d", &major, &minor) < 2) {
00232             opencl_error(string_printf("OpenCL: failed to parse OpenCL C version string (%s).", version));
00233             return false;
00234         }
00235 
00236         if(!((major == req_major && minor >= req_minor) || (major > req_major))) {
00237             opencl_error(string_printf("OpenCL: C version 1.1 or later required, found %d.%d", major, minor));
00238             return false;
00239         }
00240 
00241         /* we don't check CL_DEVICE_VERSION since for e.g. nvidia sm 1.3 cards this is
00242             1.0 even if the language features are there, just limited shared memory */
00243 
00244         return true;
00245     }
00246 
00247     bool load_binary(const string& kernel_path, const string& clbin)
00248     {
00249         /* read binary into memory */
00250         vector<uint8_t> binary;
00251 
00252         if(!path_read_binary(clbin, binary)) {
00253             opencl_error(string_printf("OpenCL failed to read cached binary %s.", clbin.c_str()));
00254             return false;
00255         }
00256 
00257         /* create program */
00258         cl_int status;
00259         size_t size = binary.size();
00260         const uint8_t *bytes = &binary[0];
00261 
00262         cpProgram = clCreateProgramWithBinary(cxContext, 1, &cdDevice,
00263             &size, &bytes, &status, &ciErr);
00264 
00265         if(opencl_error(status) || opencl_error(ciErr)) {
00266             opencl_error(string_printf("OpenCL failed create program from cached binary %s.", clbin.c_str()));
00267             return false;
00268         }
00269 
00270         if(!build_kernel(kernel_path))
00271             return false;
00272 
00273         return true;
00274     }
00275 
00276     bool save_binary(const string& clbin)
00277     {
00278         size_t size = 0;
00279         clGetProgramInfo(cpProgram, CL_PROGRAM_BINARY_SIZES, sizeof(size_t), &size, NULL);
00280 
00281         if(!size)
00282             return false;
00283 
00284         vector<uint8_t> binary(size);
00285         uint8_t *bytes = &binary[0];
00286 
00287         clGetProgramInfo(cpProgram, CL_PROGRAM_BINARIES, sizeof(uint8_t*), &bytes, NULL);
00288 
00289         if(!path_write_binary(clbin, binary)) {
00290             opencl_error(string_printf("OpenCL failed to write cached binary %s.", clbin.c_str()));
00291             return false;
00292         }
00293 
00294         return true;
00295     }
00296 
00297     string kernel_build_options()
00298     {
00299         string build_options = " -cl-fast-relaxed-math ";
00300         
00301         /* Multi Closure for nVidia cards */
00302         if(platform_name == "NVIDIA CUDA")
00303             build_options += "-D__KERNEL_SHADING__ -D__MULTI_CLOSURE__ -cl-nv-maxrregcount=24 -cl-nv-verbose ";
00304             
00305         /* No Float3 for Apple */
00306         else if(platform_name == "Apple")
00307             build_options += "-D__CL_NO_FLOAT3__ ";
00308             
00309         /* Basic shading for AMD cards (non Apple) */
00310         else if(platform_name == "AMD Accelerated Parallel Processing")
00311             build_options += "-D__KERNEL_SHADING__ -D__CL_NO_FLOAT3__ ";
00312 
00313         return build_options;
00314     }
00315 
00316     bool build_kernel(const string& kernel_path)
00317     {
00318         string build_options = kernel_build_options();
00319     
00320         ciErr = clBuildProgram(cpProgram, 0, NULL, build_options.c_str(), NULL, NULL);
00321 
00322         if(ciErr != CL_SUCCESS) {
00323             /* show build errors */
00324             char *build_log;
00325             size_t ret_val_size;
00326 
00327             clGetProgramBuildInfo(cpProgram, cdDevice, CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG, 0, NULL, &ret_val_size);
00328 
00329             build_log = new char[ret_val_size+1];
00330             clGetProgramBuildInfo(cpProgram, cdDevice, CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG, ret_val_size, build_log, NULL);
00331 
00332             build_log[ret_val_size] = '\0';
00333             opencl_error("OpenCL build failed: errors in console");
00334             fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", build_log);
00335 
00336             delete[] build_log;
00337 
00338             return false;
00339         }
00340 
00341         return true;
00342     }
00343 
00344     bool compile_kernel(const string& kernel_path, const string& kernel_md5)
00345     {
00346         /* we compile kernels consisting of many files. unfortunately opencl
00347            kernel caches do not seem to recognize changes in included files.
00348            so we force recompile on changes by adding the md5 hash of all files */
00349         string source = "#include \"kernel.cl\" // " + kernel_md5 + "\n";
00350         source = path_source_replace_includes(source, kernel_path);
00351 
00352         size_t source_len = source.size();
00353         const char *source_str = source.c_str();
00354 
00355         cpProgram = clCreateProgramWithSource(cxContext, 1, &source_str, &source_len, &ciErr);
00356 
00357         if(opencl_error(ciErr))
00358             return false;
00359 
00360         double starttime = time_dt();
00361         printf("Compiling OpenCL kernel ...\n");
00362 
00363         if(!build_kernel(kernel_path))
00364             return false;
00365 
00366         printf("Kernel compilation finished in %.2lfs.\n", time_dt() - starttime);
00367 
00368         return true;
00369     }
00370 
00371     string device_md5_hash()
00372     {
00373         MD5Hash md5;
00374         char version[256], driver[256], name[256], vendor[256];
00375 
00376         clGetPlatformInfo(cpPlatform, CL_PLATFORM_VENDOR, sizeof(vendor), &vendor, NULL);
00377         clGetDeviceInfo(cdDevice, CL_DEVICE_VERSION, sizeof(version), &version, NULL);
00378         clGetDeviceInfo(cdDevice, CL_DEVICE_NAME, sizeof(name), &name, NULL);
00379         clGetDeviceInfo(cdDevice, CL_DRIVER_VERSION, sizeof(driver), &driver, NULL);
00380 
00381         md5.append((uint8_t*)vendor, strlen(vendor));
00382         md5.append((uint8_t*)version, strlen(version));
00383         md5.append((uint8_t*)name, strlen(name));
00384         md5.append((uint8_t*)driver, strlen(driver));
00385 
00386         string options = kernel_build_options();
00387         md5.append((uint8_t*)options.c_str(), options.size());
00388 
00389         return md5.get_hex();
00390     }
00391 
00392     bool load_kernels(bool experimental)
00393     {
00394         /* verify if device was initialized */
00395         if(!device_initialized) {
00396             fprintf(stderr, "OpenCL: failed to initialize device.\n");
00397             return false;
00398         }
00399 
00400         /* verify we have right opencl version */
00401         if(!opencl_version_check())
00402             return false;
00403 
00404         /* md5 hash to detect changes */
00405         string kernel_path = path_get("kernel");
00406         string kernel_md5 = path_files_md5_hash(kernel_path);
00407         string device_md5 = device_md5_hash();
00408 
00409         /* try to use cache binary */
00410         string clbin = string_printf("cycles_kernel_%s_%s.clbin", device_md5.c_str(), kernel_md5.c_str());;
00411         clbin = path_user_get(path_join("cache", clbin));
00412 
00413         if(path_exists(clbin)) {
00414             /* if exists already, try use it */
00415             if(!load_binary(kernel_path, clbin))
00416                 return false;
00417         }
00418         else {
00419             /* compile kernel */
00420             if(!compile_kernel(kernel_path, kernel_md5))
00421                 return false;
00422 
00423             /* save binary for reuse */
00424             save_binary(clbin);
00425         }
00426 
00427         /* find kernels */
00428         ckPathTraceKernel = clCreateKernel(cpProgram, "kernel_ocl_path_trace", &ciErr);
00429         if(opencl_error(ciErr))
00430             return false;
00431 
00432         ckFilmConvertKernel = clCreateKernel(cpProgram, "kernel_ocl_tonemap", &ciErr);
00433         if(opencl_error(ciErr))
00434             return false;
00435 
00436         return true;
00437     }
00438 
00439     ~OpenCLDevice()
00440     {
00441         if(null_mem)
00442             clReleaseMemObject(CL_MEM_PTR(null_mem));
00443 
00444         map<string, device_vector<uchar>*>::iterator mt;
00445         for(mt = const_mem_map.begin(); mt != const_mem_map.end(); mt++) {
00446             mem_free(*(mt->second));
00447             delete mt->second;
00448         }
00449 
00450         if(ckPathTraceKernel)
00451             clReleaseKernel(ckPathTraceKernel);  
00452         if(ckFilmConvertKernel)
00453             clReleaseKernel(ckFilmConvertKernel);  
00454         if(cpProgram)
00455             clReleaseProgram(cpProgram);
00456         if(cqCommandQueue)
00457             clReleaseCommandQueue(cqCommandQueue);
00458         if(cxContext)
00459             clReleaseContext(cxContext);
00460     }
00461 
00462     void mem_alloc(device_memory& mem, MemoryType type)
00463     {
00464         size_t size = mem.memory_size();
00465 
00466         if(type == MEM_READ_ONLY)
00467             mem.device_pointer = (device_ptr)clCreateBuffer(cxContext, CL_MEM_READ_ONLY, size, NULL, &ciErr);
00468         else if(type == MEM_WRITE_ONLY)
00469             mem.device_pointer = (device_ptr)clCreateBuffer(cxContext, CL_MEM_WRITE_ONLY, size, NULL, &ciErr);
00470         else
00471             mem.device_pointer = (device_ptr)clCreateBuffer(cxContext, CL_MEM_READ_WRITE, size, NULL, &ciErr);
00472 
00473         opencl_assert(ciErr);
00474     }
00475 
00476     void mem_copy_to(device_memory& mem)
00477     {
00478         /* this is blocking */
00479         size_t size = mem.memory_size();
00480         ciErr = clEnqueueWriteBuffer(cqCommandQueue, CL_MEM_PTR(mem.device_pointer), CL_TRUE, 0, size, (void*)mem.data_pointer, 0, NULL, NULL);
00481         opencl_assert(ciErr);
00482     }
00483 
00484     void mem_copy_from(device_memory& mem, int y, int w, int h, int elem)
00485     {
00486         size_t offset = elem*y*w;
00487         size_t size = elem*w*h;
00488 
00489         ciErr = clEnqueueReadBuffer(cqCommandQueue, CL_MEM_PTR(mem.device_pointer), CL_TRUE, offset, size, (uchar*)mem.data_pointer + offset, 0, NULL, NULL);
00490         opencl_assert(ciErr);
00491     }
00492 
00493     void mem_zero(device_memory& mem)
00494     {
00495         if(mem.device_pointer) {
00496             memset((void*)mem.data_pointer, 0, mem.memory_size());
00497             mem_copy_to(mem);
00498         }
00499     }
00500 
00501     void mem_free(device_memory& mem)
00502     {
00503         if(mem.device_pointer) {
00504             ciErr = clReleaseMemObject(CL_MEM_PTR(mem.device_pointer));
00505             mem.device_pointer = 0;
00506             opencl_assert(ciErr);
00507         }
00508     }
00509 
00510     void const_copy_to(const char *name, void *host, size_t size)
00511     {
00512         if(const_mem_map.find(name) == const_mem_map.end()) {
00513             device_vector<uchar> *data = new device_vector<uchar>();
00514             data->copy((uchar*)host, size);
00515 
00516             mem_alloc(*data, MEM_READ_ONLY);
00517             const_mem_map[name] = data;
00518         }
00519         else {
00520             device_vector<uchar> *data = const_mem_map[name];
00521             data->copy((uchar*)host, size);
00522         }
00523 
00524         mem_copy_to(*const_mem_map[name]);
00525     }
00526 
00527     void tex_alloc(const char *name, device_memory& mem, bool interpolation, bool periodic)
00528     {
00529         mem_alloc(mem, MEM_READ_ONLY);
00530         mem_copy_to(mem);
00531         mem_map[name] = &mem;
00532     }
00533 
00534     void tex_free(device_memory& mem)
00535     {
00536         if(mem.data_pointer)
00537             mem_free(mem);
00538     }
00539 
00540     size_t global_size_round_up(int group_size, int global_size)
00541     {
00542         int r = global_size % group_size;
00543         return global_size + ((r == 0)? 0: group_size - r);
00544     }
00545 
00546     void path_trace(DeviceTask& task)
00547     {
00548         /* cast arguments to cl types */
00549         cl_mem d_data = CL_MEM_PTR(const_mem_map["__data"]->device_pointer);
00550         cl_mem d_buffer = CL_MEM_PTR(task.buffer);
00551         cl_mem d_rng_state = CL_MEM_PTR(task.rng_state);
00552         cl_int d_x = task.x;
00553         cl_int d_y = task.y;
00554         cl_int d_w = task.w;
00555         cl_int d_h = task.h;
00556         cl_int d_sample = task.sample;
00557         cl_int d_offset = task.offset;
00558         cl_int d_stride = task.stride;
00559 
00560         /* sample arguments */
00561         int narg = 0;
00562         ciErr = 0;
00563 
00564         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckPathTraceKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_data), (void*)&d_data);
00565         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckPathTraceKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_buffer), (void*)&d_buffer);
00566         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckPathTraceKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_rng_state), (void*)&d_rng_state);
00567 
00568 #define KERNEL_TEX(type, ttype, name) \
00569     ciErr |= set_kernel_arg_mem(ckPathTraceKernel, &narg, #name);
00570 #include "kernel_textures.h"
00571 
00572         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckPathTraceKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_sample), (void*)&d_sample);
00573         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckPathTraceKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_x), (void*)&d_x);
00574         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckPathTraceKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_y), (void*)&d_y);
00575         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckPathTraceKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_w), (void*)&d_w);
00576         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckPathTraceKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_h), (void*)&d_h);
00577         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckPathTraceKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_offset), (void*)&d_offset);
00578         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckPathTraceKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_stride), (void*)&d_stride);
00579 
00580         opencl_assert(ciErr);
00581 
00582         size_t workgroup_size;
00583 
00584         clGetKernelWorkGroupInfo(ckPathTraceKernel, cdDevice,
00585             CL_KERNEL_WORK_GROUP_SIZE, sizeof(size_t), &workgroup_size, NULL);
00586     
00587         workgroup_size = max(sqrt((double)workgroup_size), 1.0);
00588 
00589         size_t local_size[2] = {workgroup_size, workgroup_size};
00590         size_t global_size[2] = {global_size_round_up(local_size[0], d_w), global_size_round_up(local_size[1], d_h)};
00591 
00592         /* run kernel */
00593         ciErr = clEnqueueNDRangeKernel(cqCommandQueue, ckPathTraceKernel, 2, NULL, global_size, local_size, 0, NULL, NULL);
00594         opencl_assert(ciErr);
00595         opencl_assert(clFinish(cqCommandQueue));
00596     }
00597 
00598     cl_int set_kernel_arg_mem(cl_kernel kernel, int *narg, const char *name)
00599     {
00600         cl_mem ptr;
00601         cl_int err = 0;
00602 
00603         if(mem_map.find(name) != mem_map.end()) {
00604             device_memory *mem = mem_map[name];
00605         
00606             ptr = CL_MEM_PTR(mem->device_pointer);
00607         }
00608         else {
00609             /* work around NULL not working, even though the spec says otherwise */
00610             ptr = CL_MEM_PTR(null_mem);
00611         }
00612         
00613         err |= clSetKernelArg(kernel, (*narg)++, sizeof(ptr), (void*)&ptr);
00614         opencl_assert(err);
00615 
00616         return err;
00617     }
00618 
00619     void tonemap(DeviceTask& task)
00620     {
00621         /* cast arguments to cl types */
00622         cl_mem d_data = CL_MEM_PTR(const_mem_map["__data"]->device_pointer);
00623         cl_mem d_rgba = CL_MEM_PTR(task.rgba);
00624         cl_mem d_buffer = CL_MEM_PTR(task.buffer);
00625         cl_int d_x = task.x;
00626         cl_int d_y = task.y;
00627         cl_int d_w = task.w;
00628         cl_int d_h = task.h;
00629         cl_int d_sample = task.sample;
00630         cl_int d_resolution = task.resolution;
00631         cl_int d_offset = task.offset;
00632         cl_int d_stride = task.stride;
00633 
00634         /* sample arguments */
00635         int narg = 0;
00636         ciErr = 0;
00637 
00638         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckFilmConvertKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_data), (void*)&d_data);
00639         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckFilmConvertKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_rgba), (void*)&d_rgba);
00640         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckFilmConvertKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_buffer), (void*)&d_buffer);
00641 
00642 #define KERNEL_TEX(type, ttype, name) \
00643     ciErr |= set_kernel_arg_mem(ckFilmConvertKernel, &narg, #name);
00644 #include "kernel_textures.h"
00645 
00646         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckFilmConvertKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_sample), (void*)&d_sample);
00647         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckFilmConvertKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_resolution), (void*)&d_resolution);
00648         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckFilmConvertKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_x), (void*)&d_x);
00649         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckFilmConvertKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_y), (void*)&d_y);
00650         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckFilmConvertKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_w), (void*)&d_w);
00651         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckFilmConvertKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_h), (void*)&d_h);
00652         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckFilmConvertKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_offset), (void*)&d_offset);
00653         ciErr |= clSetKernelArg(ckFilmConvertKernel, narg++, sizeof(d_stride), (void*)&d_stride);
00654 
00655         opencl_assert(ciErr);
00656 
00657         size_t workgroup_size;
00658 
00659         clGetKernelWorkGroupInfo(ckFilmConvertKernel, cdDevice,
00660             CL_KERNEL_WORK_GROUP_SIZE, sizeof(size_t), &workgroup_size, NULL);
00661     
00662         workgroup_size = max(sqrt((double)workgroup_size), 1.0);
00663 
00664         size_t local_size[2] = {workgroup_size, workgroup_size};
00665         size_t global_size[2] = {global_size_round_up(local_size[0], d_w), global_size_round_up(local_size[1], d_h)};
00666 
00667         /* run kernel */
00668         ciErr = clEnqueueNDRangeKernel(cqCommandQueue, ckFilmConvertKernel, 2, NULL, global_size, local_size, 0, NULL, NULL);
00669         opencl_assert(ciErr);
00670         opencl_assert(clFinish(cqCommandQueue));
00671     }
00672 
00673     void task_add(DeviceTask& maintask)
00674     {
00675         list<DeviceTask> tasks;
00676 
00677         /* arbitrary limit to work around apple ATI opencl issue */
00678         if(platform_name == "Apple")
00679             maintask.split_max_size(tasks, 76800);
00680         else
00681             tasks.push_back(maintask);
00682 
00683         DeviceTask task;
00684 
00685         foreach(DeviceTask& task, tasks) {
00686             if(task.type == DeviceTask::TONEMAP)
00687                 tonemap(task);
00688             else if(task.type == DeviceTask::PATH_TRACE)
00689                 path_trace(task);
00690         }
00691     }
00692 
00693     void task_wait()
00694     {
00695     }
00696 
00697     void task_cancel()
00698     {
00699     }
00700 };
00701 
00702 Device *device_opencl_create(DeviceInfo& info, bool background)
00703 {
00704     return new OpenCLDevice(info, background);
00705 }
00706 
00707 void device_opencl_info(vector<DeviceInfo>& devices)
00708 {
00709     vector<cl_device_id> device_ids;
00710     cl_uint num_devices;
00711     cl_platform_id platform_id;
00712     cl_uint num_platforms;
00713 
00714     /* get devices */
00715     if(clGetPlatformIDs(0, NULL, &num_platforms) != CL_SUCCESS || num_platforms == 0)
00716         return;
00717 
00718     if(clGetPlatformIDs(1, &platform_id, NULL) != CL_SUCCESS)
00719         return;
00720 
00721     if(clGetDeviceIDs(platform_id, CL_DEVICE_TYPE_GPU|CL_DEVICE_TYPE_ACCELERATOR, 0, NULL, &num_devices) != CL_SUCCESS)
00722         return;
00723     
00724     device_ids.resize(num_devices);
00725 
00726     if(clGetDeviceIDs(platform_id, CL_DEVICE_TYPE_GPU|CL_DEVICE_TYPE_ACCELERATOR, num_devices, &device_ids[0], NULL) != CL_SUCCESS)
00727         return;
00728     
00729     /* add devices */
00730     for(int num = 0; num < num_devices; num++) {
00731         cl_device_id device_id = device_ids[num];
00732         char name[1024];
00733 
00734         if(clGetDeviceInfo(device_id, CL_DEVICE_NAME, sizeof(name), &name, NULL) != CL_SUCCESS)
00735             continue;
00736 
00737         DeviceInfo info;
00738 
00739         info.type = DEVICE_OPENCL;
00740         info.description = string(name);
00741         info.id = string_printf("OPENCL_%d", num);
00742         info.num = num;
00743         /* we don't know if it's used for display, but assume it is */
00744         info.display_device = true;
00745         info.advanced_shading = false;
00746 
00747         devices.push_back(info);
00748     }
00749 }

00753 #endif /* WITH_OPENCL */
